task.description: 设计一种在25度下溶剂电极材料中贵金属的6组分DES溶剂

components.name: Choline chloride
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond acceptor, provides structural stability and low-cost base

components.name: Ethylene glycol
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond donor, lowers viscosity and melting point

components.name: Glycerol
components.function: Secondary hydrogen bond donor, enhances solvation power for metals

components.name: Urea
components.function: Tertiary hydrogen bond donor, improves thermal stability and metal complexation

components.name: Lithium nitrate
components.function: Ionic additive to enhance ionic conductivity and promote noble metal dissolution via coordination

components.name: Thiourea
components.function: Specialized donor that acts as a ligand for noble metals like Au, Pd, Pt

reasoning: This 6-component DES is designed to optimize solvation of noble metals at ambient temperature (25°C) by combining multiple synergistic HBDs with complementary properties. Ethylene glycol and glycerol reduce viscosity and improve fluidity, while urea and thiourea enhance coordination to noble metal ions. Lithium nitrate introduces free Li⁺ and NO₃⁻ ions that assist in oxidative dissolution and stabilization of metal complexes. Multi-component design allows fine-tuning of polarity, donor strength, and ionic environment beyond what binary or ternary DES can achieve.

final_result.reasoning: This 6-component DES is designed to optimize solvation of noble metals at ambient temperature (25°C) by combining multiple synergistic HBDs with complementary properties. Ethylene glycol and glycerol reduce viscosity and improve fluidity, while urea and thiourea enhance coordination to noble metal ions. Lithium nitrate introduces free Li⁺ and NO₃⁻ ions that assist in oxidative dissolution and stabilization of metal complexes. Multi-component design allows fine-tuning of polarity, donor strength, and ionic environment beyond what binary or ternary DES can achieve.
supporting_evidence: Choline chloride-based DES with ethylene glycol (e.g., reline 1:2) are well-documented and liquid at 25°C.
Glycerol and urea are common HBDs in DES that improve metal solubility; urea-based systems dissolve Ag and Au oxides.
Thiourea is widely used in hydrometallurgy for gold leaching due to strong Au-thiourea complex formation (log β ~ 4–6).
Lithium salts in DES increase ionic strength and enable electrochemical applications; LiNO₃ disrupts H-bond networks and modifies solvation shells.
Multi-HBD DES systems show superior extraction efficiency for precious metals compared to binary analogs (e.g., in e-waste recycling).
final_result.synergy_explanation: Choline chloride accepts hydrogen bonds from ethylene glycol, glycerol, urea, and thiourea, creating a highly associated yet low-melting mixture. Ethylene glycol and glycerol reduce overall viscosity, enabling better mass transfer of noble metal species. Urea and thiourea cooperatively coordinate to noble metal ions (e.g., Au³⁺, Pd²⁺), with thiourea acting as a soft ligand forming stable complexes. Lithium nitrate enhances ionic dissociation and may participate in redox processes, promoting oxidative dissolution of metallic particles at the electrode interface.
